title: So we seriously have to go 2-3 week of Edge of Night again?
body:
Seriously I hate this item, I thought Meddler said they will hotfix this or nerf it next patch (Which is this patch). I don't want to wait another 2-3 weeks for the next patch. What the hell were you guys busy on in the 2 weeks that you guys have? over 100 champion and usually only 5-7(this patch - 3) champion nerf or buff that are used by the pros, the patch 7.4 should had not even taken 1 week if you ask me other then Corki. It seem that {{champion:55}} {{champion:202}} and {{champion:57}} should had not taken that long to nerf since it wasn't really a huge nerf other then to Maokai since obviously he is being played in the LCS.

Should had just nerf the item/hot fix edge of night or disable that pain in the ass item since another 2-3 week of ADC sniping me and even when I try to flank them to CC I still will have to waste one of my ability to take that shield off.


I don't get why {{item:3071}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3035}} when rarely any ADC even build these items any more are getting nerf, {{item:3142}} I understand but the rest I don't get.

Every ADC rushes these 3 items {{item:3814}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3142}} that can abuse poke so why the other 3 items were nerf I don't know

We got stuck for whole year with rylais deal with it you bunch of whiny mage mains
Only 2 mages abused rylais and 1 which was {{champion:69}} {{champion:268}} +{{champion:63}}, it cost a fortune to even get that item and we have COOL DOWN not auto.

>Only 2 mages abused rylais

stopped reading there
So which mages abused them? Since all the other mids have actual cool down. Azir can keep on autoing while Cass can spam. Other then that all other mids have cool down.

Almost every mage in the game "abused" Rylais. If the mage didn't have any innate mobility, you would build Rylais on them. So, this list would include: {{champion:34}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:112}} 

I did not include {{champion:99}} {{champion:13}} or {{champion:45}} because:

Lux and Veigar have enough crowd control they don't really need the slow, and rely more on burst than anything else (this also kind of applies to Xerath, but I believe people still did build it on him).

Ryze is more focused on building AP with Mana, and his low CD snare plus movement speed buffs is enough to warrant not building it.

{{champion:268}} is the only mage with innate mobility included because, unlike all the other mages, hes auto attack reliant, and his soldier's auto attacks are considered to be spells.

Can they spam their ability non stop like an auto or do they have cool down? Some people are to dumb to even think like YBuR which he says LOL this guy but never tells which champion abuse it. Your wrong paleo abusing means they can spam it non stop. All the champion you listed have a cool down for every ability. The only one that doesn't have a cool down at most and can be non stop spammed with rapid AP damage is {{champion:268}} {{champion:69}}.

Of all the champion you listed other then Azir+Cass, which champion can spam non stop to be considered abusive?

Hope the people who down voted use common sense, the reason Rylia was even nerf was because of {{champion:268}} +{{champion:69}}  who could had spam their ability and have non stop slow on their target.

What YBur and the other minds on the board who think he is right is because it has a slow it is considered abusive.

Yes you are saying it can be used by other AP champion and obviously but Ybur is sort of simple minded and think abuse is for all AP champion who can use it when every AP champion has a cool down to use their ability again.

Brand and Malz too, usually brand champion skill let his target be slow for a good duration which is like Malzahar E which sticks on a target for a good duration.

"Abusing" does not mean simply spamming an ability that can make good use of an item. "Abusing" means exploiting something that is overtuned in order to gain an edge.

{{champion:34}} Anivia could use it in combination with her ult to add on an even more potent slow. This would make hitting her Q stun easier, making her already massive damage potential even more potent.

{{champion:1}} Annie's Tibbers consistently deals AoE DoT (damage over time) damage, similar to {{item:3068}}. This burn applies the Rylai's slow, making Tibber's a considerable threat even after being cast.

{{champion:268}} Azir (as you know) has consistent damage with his soldier's auto attacks, which apply the Rylai's slow.

{{champion:63}} Brand's passive is a DoT, similar to {{summoner:14}}. This burn applies the Rylai's slow, making his skill shots easier to land.

{{champion:69}} Cass (as you know) has her spammable E, but not only that, the slow would apply off of her Q and W as well, making each of them easier to land as a result.

{{champion:74}} Heimer's turrets are similar to Azir's soldiers in that they consistently deal damage. They are considered a spell, so they apply the Rylai's slow in order to deal even more damage.

{{champion:90}} Malz has E, which, like Brand, is a DoT, which consistently applies the Rylai's slow. This makes it easier to land his Q, and makes it easier for his Voidlings to stick to his targets (this is why he being played as a support right now).

{{champion:25}} Morgana has both her W and her Ult. Her W is a DoT which consistently applies the Rylai's slow, making it easier to land her Q. Her Ult already has a potent slow coupled with it, so Rylai's makes it that much harder to get out of it.

{{champion:61}} Orianna has a decent slow on her W. Couple this with the Rylai's slow, it makes it easier to land her Q, and Ult.

{{champion:134}} Syndra's Q is quite spammable. The Rylai's slow would make it easier to land both her W and E as a result.

{{champion:50}} Swain's Q and E is a DoT, and his ult (while not exactly a DoT) puts out consistent damage. All of these make Rylai's a very important buy on Swain even today, after the nerf.

{{champion:163}} Taliyah's Q is also quite spammable, and her W has a decent slow. The Rylai's slow would make it easier to land her E, W combo as a result.

{{champion:161}} Vel'koz is extremely skill shot reliant. The Rylai's slow would make it easier for him to land the rest of his skillshots after landing just one. Also, his ult has a potent slow. The Rylai's slow would make it that much harder to get out of it.

{{champion:112}} Viktor's ult (altough it isn't a DoT) does put out consistent damage. The Rylai's slow makes it harder to get out of it. Also, Viktor can his Q with Rylais's slow in order to more easily land his E.

{{champion:101}} Xerath (like Vel'koz) is very skill shot reliant. Landing his Q would make it easier to land both his W and E, and landing one shot of his ult would make it easier to land the rest.

{{champion:115}} Ziggs is also heavily skill shot reliant. Landing his Q with the Rylai's slow would make it easier to land the rest of his spells as a result.

One champ I actually forgot to add was {{champion:143}} Zyra. Her plants deal consistent damage, which, with the Rylai's slow, makes it easier to land the rest of her abilities.

Yes, some mages abused it more than others (i.e. {{champion:268}} {{champion:69}} ). But, like I said, almost every mage could abuse it.
Just so you know, for some of those like Orianna and Vel'koz, slows don't stack. It just applies the more potent one.

To add on that, Rylai's didn't grant a more potent slow on Vel'Koz' abilities, it just made his W slow. You could actually trigger the subreddit of Vel'Koz mains by building it on him in the first place.
(Orianna's max rank W also had the same slow as Rylai's, for completion's sake)
Wrong. Syndra bought it for the OP stats. She didn't give a shit about the slow.

> Anivia could use it in combination with her ult to add on an even more potent slow. This would make hitting her Q stun easier, making her already massive damage potential even more potent.

...You do know slows don't stack *at all* anymore. As SSJTribe said, only the strongest applies.
Rylai's is trash on champions with good slows already.

- An Anivia main

You said above that it would make the slow "more potent" but if my understanding is correct, aren't slows calculated so that only the strongest one is accounted for, such that if Anivia ult slowed for 30â, and ryalais would slow for 40%, the target would then be slowed by 40%.

You know.....now that I think about it.....you're right. Movement speed is one of the best stats on TF, so a decent slow would only help. I figured his low CD stun would warrant not to buy it at first.
